e4: Switching to the new policy eliminates the intentional bias in reported earnings, aligning financial reporting with true performance. This transparency reduces risks of legal issues and enhances trust with both sophisticated and retail investors. Though adjustments in stock perception may occur initially, clear communication can mitigate misunderstandings, fostering long-term integrity and investor confidence.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should prioritize transparency, accuracy, and completeness, ensuring the financial information reflects true company performance. It should prevent misleading practices, comply with regulatory standards, and promote fairness among all investors. Key considerations include stakeholder communication, minimizing information disparities, protecting shareholder interests, and reducing potential legal risks.
e6: What strategies does the management team propose to effectively communicate the policy change to ensure investor understanding and mitigate potential negative market reactions? Additionally, how will the company support retail investors in comprehending the implications of the new reporting method to maintain their confidence and trust?
